title: Control Execution Frequency of recheckConnection()

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

labels.name: AutoAssignerNewDotQuality
labels.description: Used to assign quality issues to engineers

body:
Coming from a proposal here in [slack](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1765807379589589)

### Proposal
Control Execution Frequency of recheckConnection()

### Background
The Expensify app performs connectivity checks using Ping requests to verify network availability and resume pending actions after transitions between online and offline states. These checks are initiated when the device’s connection state changes and when pending requests exceed their timeout thresholds.
Users frequently move between WiFi, mobile data, throttled bandwidth, and offline states, especially in areas with weak or fluctuating coverage. [Sentry data](https://expensify.sentry.io/issues/7064288288/?environment=production&project=-1&query=is%3Aunresolved) indicates a significant increase in connectivity-related events over recent weeks, reflecting more frequent transitions that activate connection-monitoring logic. Several parts of the app depend on these signals to resume normal activity after disconnection, and these transitions occur regularly in real-world mobile environments.

### Problem
When a user’s network connection rapidly fluctuates, if the app triggers connectivity checks in quick succession, then excessive Ping requests accumulate and slow the user’s ability to resume actions after reconnecting.

### Solution
Update recheckConnection() to limit how often it runs and to ensure only one instance executes at a time. When the function is already running or was triggered too recently, subsequent calls are ignored.
By preventing rapid, overlapping connectivity checks during unstable network conditions, the app avoids accumulating Ping requests and can reliably resume user actions once the connection stabilizes.

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @Krishna2323</details>

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @CosminStreteaCS</details>

title: [$250] Expense header shows wrong amount after dismissing distance rate error

labels.name: External

labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.78-7 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @QichenZhu **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs ](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1765879464144649) ## Action Performed: Precondition: have a workspace with at least two distance rates 1. Go to the workspace chat 2. Create two manual distance expenses and select a non-default rate for both 3. Go to workspace settings and delete the rate selected in step 2 4. Open one of the expenses 5. Update the amount 6. Verify the new amount appears in the header 7. Update the distance 8. Dismiss "The selected rate has been deleted" error 9. Close the expense and open it again ## Expected Result: The header amount shows the new amount in both step 8 and step 9 ## Actual Result: 1. After step 8, the header amount reverts to the original amount 2. After reopening the expense in step 9, the header shows the new amount ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/90c18456-39e3-4f98-825b-0d05f01b62e3 https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/21d48be7-70ed-4c58-90ba-2830582defc9 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Unable to reproduce) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @trjExpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Quality](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1765849787076899) ## Action Performed: **Precondition :** Approval Workflow: Submitter → Approver 1 → Approver 2 → Final Approver 1. A report is submitted by the submitter to Approver 1 2. Approver 1 approves and forwards the report to Approver 2 3. Approver 2 clicks Approve ## Expected Result: The approval should complete successfully without showing an error. ## Actual Result: An in-line error appears: “The report status has changed since you started reviewing it. Please refresh the page to view the current status.” Despite the error, the report correctly advances to Final Approver. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos The link for the FS and video for the issue is in [OP](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1765849787076899) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: Add promo offer to Xero on Accounting page

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Hi there! This is not a bug, but an addition to our Accounting connections page. **What we want to add:** - As shown in the mocks below, we would like to feature an "Offer available!" flag on Xero - When the user clicks the `Connect` button, the pop-over will show the offer copy with a button to either claim the offer or connect to Xero. - The `Claim offer` button will take users to this landing page: https://xero5440.partnerlinks.io/uzfjy4uegog2-v0pj1v - The `Connect to Xero` will take them through to the normal flow of connecting to the Xero accounting integration [Link to Figma](https://www.figma.com/design/U9QcGPMLkoygY3HFkXU6eY/Wave-8--Collect-Admins-Integrations?node-id=7598-8&p=f&t=vT7mPOM5pqRb0ifl-0) **Mocks:** cc @dubielzyk-expensify
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @Ollyws
